title: Here are the Mass. residents who made the new Forbes list of 400 richest Americans
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Nine Massachusetts residents feature in Forbes' list of 400 richest Americans, with net worths ranging from $3.9 billion to $35 billion.
Abigail Johnson, CEO of Fidelity Investments, is the richest in Massachusetts, ranking 27th nationwide with a net worth of $35 billion.
Patriots owner Robert Kraft ranks as the 78th wealthiest American with a $13.8 billion net worth, owning multiple sports franchises.

title: In most anticipated series at Fenway in years, Red Sox faceplant against Yankees in opener
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Red Sox were defeated 4-1 by the Yankees at Fenway Park, managing only two hits.
Boston's offensive struggles included going 0-for-8 with runners in scoring position.
The Red Sox committed three errors, contributing to their loss against the Yankees.

title: Former Patriots DE Deatrich Wise Jr. suffers season-ending injury
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Deatrich Wise Jr. suffered a season-ending left quad injury during a game against the Green Bay Packers.
Wise, now with Washington Commanders, got injured attempting to block an extra point in the second quarter.
Wise thanked fans for support after injury; he's a nine-year NFL veteran and former New England Patriots player.

title: When will Connelly Early pitch next for Red Sox? Alex Cora explains
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Connelly Early is a candidate to start Tuesday for the Red Sox against the Athletics at Fenway Park.
Early impressed in his MLB debut, striking out 11 A's batters over five scoreless innings.
Manager Alex Cora is evaluating options among young pitchers including Early, Payton Tolle, and Kyle Harrison.

title: Scott Boras says he, Alex Bregman are ‘waiting until the offseason’ before making opt-out decision
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Scott Boras and Alex Bregman will decide on contract opt-out after the season ends.
Bregman's contract with the Red Sox allows an opt-out after the 2025 and 2026 seasons.
Bregman, 31, has a .279 average with 16 home runs and 57 RBI this season despite an injury setback.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Misery' (1990) is now streaming on HBO Max, featuring Kathy Bates' Oscar-winning performance in a Stephen King adaptation.
'This Is Spinal Tap' (1984), a pioneering mockumentary, is streaming on Xumo ahead of its sequel release.
'Only Murders in the Building' Season 5 is available on Hulu, with a cast including Steve Martin, Martin Short, and Selena Gomez.

title: Patriots injury report: Christian Gonzalez, Keion White ruled out vs. Dolphins
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Cornerback Christian Gonzalez and defensive end Keion White were ruled out for the Patriots against the Dolphins due to injuries.
Gonzalez has been sidelined since July 28 with a hamstring injury and missed Week 1 against the Raiders.
Keion White is out with an illness after playing 46% of defensive snaps in Week 1 against the Raiders.

title: With DC Terrell Williams out, who will be calling defensive plays for Patriots vs. Dolphins?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots' inside linebackers coach Zak Kuhr will handle defensive play-calling against the Dolphins in Week 2.
Head coach Mike Vrabel affirmed confidence in Zak Kuhr, citing his past experience and preparation for the role.
Defensive coordinator Terrell Williams remains absent due to health issues unrelated to previous offseason concerns.

title: Boston activist Monica Cannon-Grant to plead guilty in federal fraud case
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Monica Cannon-Grant plans to plead guilty in a federal fraud case, originally set for trial in Boston on October 14.
Cannon-Grant and her late husband were charged with defrauding donors and lying on a mortgage application and unemployment claims.
Prosecutors allege the couple misused nonprofit funds for personal expenses, including hotels, restaurants, and personal travel.

title: Here’s what we know about Tyler Robinson, Charlie Kirk’s alleged assassin
author: The Associated Press
bullets: Tyler James Robinson, 22, was arrested in Utah for the alleged murder of Charlie Kirk on UVU campus.
Robinson, a third-year student at Dixie Technical College, had no prior criminal history according to court records.
Robinson allegedly acted alone, with charging documents citing his recent political interest and criticism of Kirk.
